channel.title: Internship on Abdul Baari Davids
channel.description: Recent content in Internship on Abdul Baari Davids

item.title: My experience as a Technical Writing Intern at Ritza
item.description:
I’m still working here so in the meantime, here’s a list of things I’ve worked on and contributed to:

Release

  • Updated and wrote new documentation

Enterprise Bot

  • Worked on a framework for evaluating LLMs

  • Also wrote a couple articles

  • And benchmarked different AI Agent providers.

Sentry

  • Wrote some help guides

Coherence

  • Made this cool example app using Django and Postgres and then wrote guides on setting it up using Coherence.

item.title: My Experience as a SDE Intern at Codeinfinity
item.description:
Disclaimer:

I did have to sign an NDA, so I can’t go too in depth on certain things. But I’ll do my best to capture the essence of it and my feelings.

After my first year at university and countless personal projects under my belt, I was eager to secure a software development internship to “get my foot in the door” of the industry. However, the reality in South Africa is that student internships are less common compared to other countries, and even experienced graduates face challenges finding jobs. Regardless of these obstacles, I persevered in my search for an opportunity to gain valuable experience. I started by applying to the few companies that advertised student internships and after a couple of rejected interviews and a fail on the AWS OA, I felt discouraged.
